alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mercer, northwestern Burlington, southeastern Bucks and northeastern Philadelphia Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beverly, or 11 miles southwest of Trenton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Bensalem, Ewing, Willingboro, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Riverside, Bordentown, Pennington, Beverly, Yardley, Newtown, Tullytown, Langhorne, Washington Crossing, Feasterville-Trevose, Florence-Roebling and Northeast Philadelphia. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 6A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 350 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 32 and 40. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 43 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southern, central and northwestern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
